content: Instead of NONE. You could have put something meaningful.

Damn!!
thought i was doing a quick contrib and that's it
but it seems it wasn't only quick but really dirty too ^^

Ok guys i have updated : added test cases + the answer is not a boolean if the 2 boxes are overlapping anymore but it is the overlapping distance

Hope that's better
;)

I agree with kayou, exceptionally bad clash for reverse.
There are only four test cases, and many solutions which would give you 100% percent on test cases and only 25% or even 0% on validators.
Reverse clashes are the hardest to solve, so one is right to expect an unambiguous pattern and a solid consistency between test cases and validators, which is unfortunately not the case here.
Ten different players - ten different solutions getting 100% on test cases but failing on validators (in a private game). Very bad for reverse, please remove!
It is possible in reverse to get 100% on the test cases with about 10 different mthods

Very bad clash for Reverse my code gives 100% for the tests but only 25% for validators, in a clash we were 6 out of 8 to have 25 or 50% for validators when it was 100% for the tests. Avoid giving a goal when your proposal is for Reverse only, because the mode of the clash is after the goal so people testing your clash will already know what to do.

here an example of code with 100 test and 25% validators:
a,b = map(int,input().split())
c,d = map(int,input().split())
r= b+a == d-c
print('YES' if r else 'NO')

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: nice and quick

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Binary outputs should be avoided in Clash of Code because solutions like print("YES") get easy 50%. It's especially bad in reverse mode because there are multiple patterns that will fit when there's only two options for each test case. An example of a pattern that would get all (visible) tests right is "is the absolute value of the last number on the first row smaller than the absolute value of the last number on the last row". Also needs way more test cases. Only half of the tests (1, 3, 5, and 7) are visible to players; the other half is used to validate the answer.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting and fun puzzle for clash of code.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting in reverse mode

Oh yeah didn't notice that !
you are absolutely right

Ok this clash has been accepted anyway so for the next propositions i will take this comment in account
